message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This analysis combines data from the World Bank's Enterprise survey and the Doing Business report to explore the relationship between business formalization and access to credit in low-income economies.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise survey", "Doing Business report"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We use a combination of cross-country data from the UN Development Programme, the World Health Organization, and the World Bank to examine the relationship between health outcomes and government expenditure on health.", "dataset": ["UN Development Programme data", "World Health Organization data", "World Bank data"], "topic": ["Health", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This paper employs an event study design to analyze the effects of floods across the United States using data on extreme precipitation events from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA).", "dataset": ["National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) data"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using a panel dataset of over 1 million firms in developing countries, we examine the impact of competition on firm-level productivity and innovation, as measured by the World Bank's Enterprise survey and the Global Innovation Index.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise survey", "Global Innovation Index"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We use household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) to explore the pathways through which maternal education affects child nutrition outcomes in low-income settings.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS)"], "topic": ["Education", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "To identify the effect of natural resource wealth on economic development, we take advantage of a new dataset on resource-rich areas from the Natural Resource Governance Institute (NRGI), which we match with a comprehensive panel dataset of countries from the World Bank.", "dataset": ["Natural Resource Governance Institute (NRGI) data", "World Bank data"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We use administrative data on tax returns and linked birth records to measure the impact of income and child support policy on family formation and dissolution in the United States.", "dataset": ["administrative data on tax returns", "linked birth records"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using a dataset of women-owned microenterprises in Africa, Asia, and Latin America from the International Labour Organization, we assess the effects of mentorship and training on enterprise growth and sustainability.", "dataset": ["International Labour Organization data"], "topic": ["Gender", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This study draws on a large-scale survey of residents in urban and peri-urban areas in three metropolitan cities in India conducted by the Energy Policy Institute to investigate the determinants of household energy consumption and adoption of clean cooking technologies.", "dataset": ["survey data from Energy Policy Institute"], "topic": ["Energy", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "We compile a dataset of bilateral migration stocks and flows from 1960 to 2020 for all countries in the world using data from the United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs, the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), and the World Bank.", "dataset": ["bilateral migration data from United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs", "Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) data", "World Bank data"], "topic": ["Migration"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the relationship between infrastructure investment and regional development outcomes in China, this study uses a dataset compiled by the National Development and Reform Commission based on China's officially planned infrastructure projects in 2005-2014, complemented by data from official statistics and other sources.", "dataset": ["National Development and Reform Commission data", "official statistics"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Regional Integration"]}]
